title: Automatic for the People
summary: Automatic for the People is the eighth studio album by American alternative rock band R.E.M., released by Warner Bros. Records on OctoberÂ 5, 1992 in the United Kingdom and Europe, and on the following day in the United States. R.E.M. began production on the album while their previous album, Out of Time (1991), was still ascending top albums charts and achieving global success. Aided by string arrangements from John Paul Jones, Automatic for the People features ruminations on mortality, loss, mourning and nostalgia.
